document.masterDocTitle: Genus Stathmopoda Herrich-Schäffer, 1853 (Lepidoptera: Stathmopodidae) from China (III): Descriptions of fourteen new species

Diagnosis. This species is similar to
S. luxuriivora
Terada, 2012
in appearance and in the features of the male genitalia. It can be distinguished by the forewing lacking a distal brown patch; in the male genitalia by the sub-rectangular cucullus uniformly wide to obtuse apex and the aedeagus with numerous spicules ranging from basal 2/5 to 4/5; in the female genitalia by the crescent signum located close to the posterior margin the corpus bursae and a bulla at distal 1/4. In
S. luxuriivora
, the forewing has a brown distal patch; the oval cucullus is gradually narrowed to apex and the aedeagus lacks spicules; the bar-shaped signum is located at middle and the bulla is absent ( Terada 2016 , P. 44, 197, Figs 51–54 , III-3).

Description. Adult ( Fig. 24 ). Wingspan 11.5‒14.0 mm. Head with frons silvery white; vertex ochreous yellow; occiput dark brown. Labial palpus silvery white on inner surface, second segment pale yellow on outer surface, third segment ochreous yellow on outer surface. Antenna ochreous yellow; flagellum yellow annulated with light brown in distal half. Collar dark brown; thorax yellow, dark brown posteromedially; tegula yellow except brown at base. Forewing yellow; costal margin dark brown along basal 3/4, with a small yellow spot at base; first dark brown fascia near base, its outer margin obliquely outward; second dark brown fascia from basal 1/4 of costal margin obliquely outward to basal 2/5 of dorsal margin; dorsal margin with a semi-oval spot at basal 2/3, obliquely outward, reaching outer margin of cell anteriorly, joined with second fascia by a slender dark brown streak on dorsal margin; fringe grey. Hindwing and fringe brown. Legs ochreous yellow dorsally, cream white ventrally; foreleg with tibia blackish brown on outer surface, tarsus blackish brown at apex of each tarsomere; midleg with tibia blackish brown at base on dorsal surface, with pale yellowish brown bristles at middle and apex, tarsus blackish brown at apex; hindleg with tibia annulated with blackish brown and bearing long pale ochreous yellow bristles at basal 1/3, 2/3 and apex respectively, middle and distal spurs ochreous yellow, tarsus blackish brown and with ochreous yellow bristles at apices of basal two tarsomeres, blackish brown at apex. Abdomen yellowish brown on dorsal surface, greyish white on ventral surface.
Distribution. China ( Fujian , Hainan , Tianjin , Yunnan ); Sri Lanka ( Kasy 1973: 271 ).
Notes. This species is newly recorded for China .
